snippet: Neil Heywood, a businessman with ties to the ousted Politburo member Bo Xilai, allegedly handled large sums of money for the family before he was found dead in November.
abstract: Neil Heywood, British businessman with ties to former Chinese Politburo member Bo Xilai, is believed to have transferred large sums of money overseas illicitly for Bo's family before his death in November 2011; disclosure may help explain the relationship between Heywood and the Bo family, in particular Bo's wife Gu Kailai, who has been arrested on suspicion in involvement with Heywood's death.

byline.original: By SHARON LaFRANIERE and MICHAEL WINES
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Ansfield and Ian Johnson from Beijing, Richard Macauley from Chongqing, China, and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: Neil Heywood, a businessman with ties to the ousted Politburo member Bo Xilai, allegedly handled large sums of money for the family before he was found dead in November.

headline.seo: Overseas Money Transfers Alleged in Bo Xilai Scandal
headline.main: Briton in a Chinese Scandal Reportedly Brokered Overseas Money Transfers
headline.print_headline: Briton in a Chinese Scandal Reportedly Brokered Overseas Money Transfers
